meanings.definition: An early symptom indicating the onset of a disease
meanings.sent1: The sudden headache was a prodromes of the flu.
meanings.sent2: The fever was a clear prodromes that she was getting sick.
meanings.sent3: His constant sneezing was a prodromes that he needed a break from work.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathering in the sky were the prodromes of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The rumbling in his stomach served as a prodromes of his hunger.

meanings.definition: A precursor or warning sign of an event
meanings.sent1: The sudden drop in temperature was a prodromes of the coming snowstorm.
meanings.sent2: The increased tension in the room was a clear prodromes of an impending argument.
meanings.sent3: The flickering lights were a prodromes that the power outage was imminent.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of sirens served as a prodromes of the approaching emergency.
meanings.sent5: The first raindrops were a prodromes of the heavy downpour to come.
